title: quarkus add ngrok does not find ngrok extension

labels.name: triage/out-of-date
labels.description: This issue/PR is no longer valid or relevant

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

given #25847 does not add exact version I wondered if `quarkus ext add ngrok` would look up possible extensions and thus get the version info but it does not find the extension.

imo if nothing found in the platform the cli/mvn plugin should query the registry for a possible extension as a fallback so non platform features can be found via cli just like code.quarkus.io enables.
